description: She had quit after the military refused to act on her reports of routine sexual harassment. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Ex-soldier hopes coming forward will shine light on ‘routine’ sexual harassment in Japanese army
title_page: Ex-soldier hopes coming forward will shine light on ‘routine’ sexual harassment in Japanese army | The Straits Times
maintext:
TOKYO – Fleeing to an evacuation shelter after a tsunami swept through her coastal hometown in Miyagi prefecture on March 11, 2011, a young Rina Gonoi saw first-hand the relief work led by Japan’s military Self-Defence Forces (SDF).
Inspired to be a force for good, the then 11-year-old fifth-grader saw the SDF as her dream job, and joined the army in April 2020.
